name: tinfoil
title: Tinfoil
description: Improves privacy by automatically setting some hidden preferences only available through about:config. Use the 'Full Tinfoil' button in the addon preferences to make some more changes that are also available through Firefox's normal user interface. That doesn't cover every available option, as some are situational, like User Agent.

preferences.name: keepSettings
preferences.title: Keep settings on uninstall
preferences.label: Persist Settings
preferences.description: Firefox settings are normally reverted to preinstallation state when Tinfoil is uninstalled. This setting stops Tinfoil from making any changes when disabled or removed. WARNING: Due to a bug in the Mozilla SDK this does not currently work. The code is in place so hopefully when the bug is resolved it will work correctly.

preferences.name: btnFull
preferences.title: Go Full Tinfoil
preferences.label: Full Tinfoil
preferences.description: Apply all recommended settings. May cause some sites to lose functionality. Does not apply all possible Tinfoil-managed settings.

preferences.name: btnDefaults
preferences.title: Reset addon to default state
preferences.label: Defaults
preferences.description: Revert to Tinfoil defaults. First step if sites malfunction after going Full Tinfoil.

preferences.name: btnRestore
preferences.title: Restore your settings from before Tinfoil
preferences.label: Restore
preferences.description: This is necessary before uninstall/disable if you want to revert to your prior settings, because of a Mozilla SDK bug which currently ignores 'unload' events.

preferences.name: btnReset
preferences.title: Reset all managed settings to Firefox's default state
preferences.label: Reset
preferences.description: This is necessary before uninstall/disable if you want to revert to Firefox default settings, because of a Mozilla SDK bug which currently ignores 'unload' events.

preferences.name: browserCacheDiskEnable
preferences.title: browser.cache.disk.enable
preferences.description: When a page is loaded, it can be cached so it doesn't need to be downloaded to be redisplayed. For e-mail and news, messages and attachments are cached as well. This preference controls whether to use the hard drive for caching purposes.

preferences.name: browserCacheMemoryEnable
preferences.title: browser.cache.memory.enable
preferences.description: When a page is loaded, it can be cached so it doesn't need to be rerendered to be redisplayed. For e-mail and news, messages and attachments are cached as well. This preference controls whether to use memory to cache decoded images, messages, chrome (application user interface elements), and secure (https) pages

preferences.name: browserCacheOfflineEnable
preferences.title: browser.cache.offline.enable
preferences.description: Recent versions of Mozilla offer an 'offline cache' that web applications can use to store data for retrieval even when the browser is offline. Combined with online/offline events, developers can write JavaScript that acts intelligently until the connection is restored.

preferences.name: browserNewtabpageEnabled
preferences.title: browser.newtabpage.enabled
preferences.description: Use a special page for new tabs. This could display private information, since the default is to show thumbnails of visited pages.

preferences.name: browserNewtabUrl
preferences.title: browser.newtab.url
preferences.description: What to use as newtab page.

preferences.name: browserThumbnailsDisabled
preferences.title: browser.pagethumbnails.capturing_disabled
preferences.description: Stop Firefox from taking screenshots for use as thumbnails on the newtab page. The screenshots could contain sensitive information.

preferences.name: browserSafebrowsingEnabled
preferences.title: browser.safebrowsing.enabled
preferences.description: Firefox 2.0 incorporates the Google Safe Browsing extension in its own Phishing Protection feature to detect and warn users of phishy web sites.

preferences.name: browserSafebrowsingMalwareEnabled
preferences.title: browser.safebrowsing.malware.enabled
preferences.description: As part of its Safe Browsing feature, Mozilla Firefox keeps track of a list of malware to compare against data the user downloads. In the event the user downloads known malware, a warning can be displayed. This preference determines whether to enable these malware checks.

preferences.name: browserSearchSuggestEnabled
preferences.title: browser.search.suggest.enabled
preferences.description: In Firefox 2.0, search plugins can offer 'search suggestions' of similar search queries as the user enters a query in the search bar. This preference controls whether or not search suggestions are enabled.

preferences.name: browserSendPings
preferences.title: browser.send_pings
preferences.description: The Web Applications 1.0 specification (also known as HTML5) defines a new attribute for <a> elements: ping. This attribute contains one or more URIs to “ping” (send a POST request to) when the user clicks the link. The attribute would be useful for letting websites track visitors’ clicks.

preferences.name: browserStartupPage
preferences.title: browser.startup.page
preferences.description: Each time the web browser starts, this preference is consulted to determine what to display. It has superseded browser.sessionstore.resume_session as the preference determining whether saved sessions are restored.

preferences.name: datareportingHealthreportServiceEnabled
preferences.title: datareporting.healthreport.service.enabled
preferences.description: Enables Health Report. While this type of data is useful to development and, ultimately, users, it could leak information.

preferences.name: datareportingHealthreportUploadEnabled
preferences.title: datareporting.healthreport.uploadingEnabled
preferences.description: Sends Health Report data to Mozilla. While this type of data is useful to development and, ultimately, users, it could leak information.

preferences.name: domEventClipboardeventsEnabled
preferences.title: dom.event.clipboardevents.enabled
preferences.description: lets websites get notifications if the user copies, pastes, or cuts something from a web page, and it lets them know which part of the page had been selected. The emitting of the oncopy, oncut and onpaste events are controlled by this preference.

preferences.name: domStorageEnabled
preferences.title: dom.storage.enabled
preferences.description: The Web Applications 1.0 specification defines a mechanism allowing web pages to store information with a web browser (similar to cookies) called “client-side session and persistent storage.” Although use of session storage is subject to a user’s cookie preferences, this preference allows it to be disabled entirely.

preferences.name: generalUseragentOverride
preferences.title: general.useragent.override
preferences.description: Customize User Agent. Likely to break websites. Clearing this textbox resets to default. Information from http://techblog.willshouse.com/2012/01/03/most-common-user-agents/

preferences.name: geoEnabled
preferences.title: geo.enabled
preferences.description: Reports geographical location. If disabled, note that sites could still have some idea of your location based on your IP address.

preferences.name: networkCookieCookieBehavior
preferences.title: network.cookie.cookieBehavior
preferences.description: What cookies are allowed

preferences.name: networkCookieLifetimePolicy
preferences.title: network.cookie.lifetimePolicy
preferences.description: How long cookies are kept

preferences.name: networkDnsDisablePrefetch
preferences.title: network.dns.disablePrefetch
preferences.description: DNS prefetching was implemented in Firefox 3.5 to improve page load time. This feature allows Firefox to perform domain name resolution proactively and in parallel for hyperlinks, images, CSS, JavaScript, and other webpage content.

preferences.name: networkHttpRefererSpoofSource
preferences.title: network.http.referer.spoofSource
preferences.description: Send target as referrer.

preferences.name: networkHttpRefererXOriginPolicy
preferences.title: network.http.referer.XOriginPolicy
preferences.description: Referrer cross-site origin policy defines when to send referrers.

preferences.name: networkHttpSendRefererHeader
preferences.title: network.http.sendRefererHeader
preferences.description: As part of HTTP, requests can include a 'Referer' (sic) header that tells the server which page the user was on that initiated the request. Servers use this information to track users' paths through the site and possibly provide additional features.

preferences.name: networkHttpSendSecureXSiteReferrer
preferences.title: network.http.sendSecureXSiteReferrer
preferences.description: The HTTP spec specifies that going from a secure (https) server to a non-secure (http) server should not result in a Referer header being sent, but does not define whether a Referer should be sent between two secure sites. This preferences controls that option.

preferences.name: networkPrefetchNext
preferences.title: network.prefetch-next
preferences.description: Link prefetching is when a webpage hints to the browser that certain pages are likely to be visited, so the browser downloads them immediately so they can be displayed immediately when the user requests it.

preferences.name: networkProxySocksRemoteDns
preferences.title: network.proxy.socks_remote_dns
preferences.description: This preference controls whether DNS lookups for SOCKS v5 clients happen on the client or on the proxy server. *** NOTE: There's a bug report saying that this setting is ignored. It's here in hopes that it's fixed down the road.

preferences.name: pluginStateFlash
preferences.title: plugin.state.flash
preferences.description: Restrict Flash for security and privacy.

preferences.name: pluginsClickToPlay
preferences.title: plugins.click_to_play
preferences.description: prevents plugin content from loading until you activate the plugin.

preferences.name: pluginsEnumerableNames
preferences.title: plugins.enumerable_names
preferences.description: Allows enumeration of plugins, which can be used for tracking/fingerprinting. Note that even if disabled, sites could still test for individual plugins and tell that they're present even if they're inaccessible due to Click to Play setting.

preferences.name: privacyDonottrackheaderEnabled
preferences.title: privacy.donottrackheader.enabled
preferences.description: The Do Not Track header field requests sites not track users. Its efficacy is debatable, however, as no site is obligated to honor the request. At the same time, it adds more identifiable information to browsing that can be used for fingerprinting.

preferences.name: toolkitTelemetryEnabled
preferences.title: toolkit.telemetry.enabled
preferences.description: Sends browser statistics to Mozilla.
